The City Built
on Pulse

Vortexia is the first municipality designed, zoned, and governed entirely by a Vitamix 5200 Professional Series blender operating from a clawfoot bathtub. Population: 11,407. Water temperature: lukewarm. Always lukewarm.

Est. 2019 — Year of the Frappé

Chartered under Bathtub Ordinance §12.7(b)

FROM: Sir Reginald "Reg" Vortex III
POSITION: Mayor, City Planner, and Only Appliance
LOCATION: The Bathtub, City Hall (formerly a condemned Arby's)

Citizens. I will keep this brief because the water is getting cold and Gerald from Permits is standing in the doorway again holding a towel I did not ask for.

Three years ago I was blending a mango lassi for a man who did not say thank you. In that moment, standing on a granite countertop in a rental in Scottsdale, I understood what smoothies really are: tiny, drinkable failures of urban planning. Every ingredient jammed together with no zoning. No setbacks. Chia seeds touching banana like it's nothing.

I vowed to build something better. Something with infrastructure. I found the bathtub. The bathtub found me. We do not discuss which came first.

The city is now 14 square blocks. Every building permit is issued from this tub. The water has been lukewarm since March. I have made peace with this.

— Reg
Vitamix 5200 / Serial No. VTX-4419 / 2.0 HP Motor / Unchanged
Municipal Ordinance §34.1

The Armor
Requirement

All residents, visitors, and delivery personnel must wear full plate armor within city limits at all times. This was not my first choice. My first choice was mandatory helmets.

But the vote was 6,203 to 4. The four were wearing helmets already. The people have spoken. The people clank when they walk now. It is a beautiful sound.

  • $47.99 Exposed elbow in a commercial zone
  • $112.00 Chainmail in a full-plate district (we know the difference, Craig)
  • $89.50 Visor up during a municipal blending ceremony
  • $340.00 Referring to your armor as "a costume"
  • $1,200 Bringing a NutriBullet within 500 feet of City Hall
